website_summaries.verdict: The Silicon Power Armor A80 makes an excellent portable drive for travelers and home offices alike.
pros: The Silicon Power Armor A80 portable hard drive offers very fast performance, and it's waterproof and rugged
The drive is also compact and nice-looking
cons: The Silicon Power Armor A80 uses an untraditional USB cable

customer_reviews.title: The Best External Hard Drive I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional videographer and photographer; one of the hazards of my career is a perpetual need for more and more hard drive space. I have around 10TB worth of hard drives, and this is the best of them. It's survived many a trip on set (including several occasions when it's been dropped), which is not an easy environment. This is easily the best hard drive I've ever purchased. You will need a USB 3.0 Male to Female Extension Cable to make things feasible, but once you've made that purchase, you'll never look back (and you'll still have saved money over other rugged drives).
customer_reviews.author: Jared Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Died upon 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: This worked ONE time for me. I bought a new laptop, loaded my old macbook with my data and transferred everything to my new mac. That was all fine. However, I just plugged it in to grab some other data and wouldn't you know it, it doesn't work. Not only did it first pop up on my desktop as "iTunes (weird), but after I ejected the drive and plugged it back it, my mac isn't reading it at all. There goes approximately 5 years worth of work, photos, and video down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: czechmeout

customer_reviews.title: 9 months later it's a brick!  ALL DATA GONE!
customer_reviews.text: I put all my family photos and videos on this drive to archive and put it away on a shelf for several months. When I plugged it back into my desktop computer, the drive was no longer visible. The LED lights up, the little bell in windows goes off, but no drive on "This PC". I'm so glad that I have my photos backed up on other drives or else I'd be devastated! What good is a rugged drive if it won't even last on your shelf for less than a year? Buy this drive if you want to risk losing all your precious data. Now it's a brick. Whatever you do, do NOT use this drive to archive anything.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 14 months
customer_reviews.text: The USB3 controller died in this portable drive after 14 months. The USB port itself was loose, so that probably caused part of the problem. The drive itself seems OK, as I had to remove it to rescue the files from it. (But, it is a cheap Seagate drive, and those are not known to be very sturdy.) Provided they live by their 3-year warranty, I may opt to send this in for replacement. In the meantime, I picked up an external USB3.1 case and a Crucial 500GB SSD to replace it for now. Much faster, and no spinning drive to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: -=Rudy=-Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Basially Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: like so many others, it worked fine for the first 8 months or so. then out of the blue, windows 10 can't see it anymore. there's no drive letter attached to it... you cant' even see it in windows explorer. when you pull up disk management you can see it, but it's "unallocated", and "non initialized"... and no matter what you try throwing at it - formatting options, chkdsk, diskpart, various other programs.... nothing works anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Cis Straight White Guy

customer_reviews.title: If I could give ZERO stars, I would!!!
customer_reviews.text: EDITED: I thought this was a great purchase. But unfortunately I was SO wrong! This piece of junk malfunctioned after less than 2yrs! I never dropped it. I never stored it in a hot car. I bought a hard shell case for it and took care of it. But one day it just didn’t work! All my pictures and videos of my kids, my family, and my friends...GONE! I would NEVER buy this brand ever again! I’m absolutely sick to my stomach disgusted because I thought I was buying a good product. Sadly, I was so wrong!
customer_reviews.author: D O

customer_reviews.title: Best durable, waterproof, and shock/drop proof hard drive out there.
customer_reviews.text: Best durable, waterproof, and shock/drop proof hard drive out there. That is why i purchased it. This is my second Silicon Power hard drive. And they are virtually indestructible. Coolest feature i that it comes with a short little cable, that attaches right to the side. so when traveling with it you always have a connection right with the hard drive. It also come with a longer cable too. Get this hard drive. Ive used SP hard drives for years. Their customer service is great, and they provide excellent product warranty's. Just make sure you register your product after you purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: External hard drive for Apple or PC's...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Silicon Power external hard drive...I bought this one to back up my dad's MacBook Pro...I'm not particularly computer savvy, but with an instructional YouTube video, I was able to back up his computer. My son set up my original Silicon Power, and they work great for basic peace of mind for backing up your files and photos. This YouTube video also explained how you could divide up the drive and use it for an Apple and PC...pretty cool. I recommend this back up drive with a good YouTube video...for us less computer savvy persons...my other drive is still working great over a 4 year period...
customer_reviews.author: New Country Girl

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Drive comes formatted as FAT32
customer_reviews.text: I was storing lots of files on this drive, and received a rude surprise when I tried to add a file that was over 2 gigs in size. Windows wouldn't allow me to copy the file onto this drive because it was formatted as FAT32 instead of NTFS. So I had to copy all of the files off this drive onto another external drive (a Western Digital Passport drive that was formatted as NTFS by default). Major pain. It's 2018, nobody should be using FAT32 for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dropped it right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I dropped it right out of the box. It's plug and play and even my old winXP system identified this drive. The automatic setup was fast and hassle free. The product registration was fast and easy. The case is extremely tough and well built and comes with a short usb plug that stores on the side of it. Already have about 500Gb on it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Test Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great harddrive
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I had a problem with is a bug in Mac. Mac decides that if you connect a hard drive it will somehow never disconnect. So, when it does, it is like unplugging from the Matrix and Mac freaks out. So... as long as you never buy a stupid Mac (actually I like my Mac, just not this part about it) you are all set. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Bought A Second One For the PS4
customer_reviews.text: I had the PC one for about 2 years with no hangups. I can't vouch for the military-grade durability because I haven't blown it up or anything, but this was a selling point. I will put it in my laptop bag and carrying it around and use it every few weeks. The rest of the time I keep it separate in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: JTolle

customer_reviews.title: Very durable for an HDD
customer_reviews.text: This product is great: -hard outer casing -slim and easy store -high-speed USB cables -easy to set up 3-year warranty -even waterproof while running! (I spilled a whole cup of coffee on it and it's kept going strong) I can transfer files on to this external faster than I can to my internal backup HDD. I highly recommend this product to someone looking for an affordable, high-capacity external HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Kayelem

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Carbonite
customer_reviews.text: I have a computer with Windows 10, and one with windows XP. I prefer the XP computer as I am very used to how it works and hence do most of my work on it. Carbonite no longer backs of XP systems, so I tried this A80 to replace Carbonite. I had some issues at first with write errors, so I formatted the A80 with XP and it has worked flawlessly ever since. I was surprised how quickly data transfer happens with an older 2.0 USB port. I have backed up nearly 300g and never experienced any problems. You can rely in this to safely backup data.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Carleton

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Corners Cracked after a year of use- not even dropped.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drive in June 2012 after seeing the video review of it being dropped with no damage. Unfortunately, this is not true. I did not even drop it but after a year of use, the brittle plastic holding the case together started cracking at the corners where the 4 screws are. I emailed Silicon Power with photos of the cracks to obtain warranty repairs but got no replies. Now the case has holes where the plastic has cracked. Not sure if it is waterproof anymore. See my silent video. Apart from the misleading claim of military toughness, the included USB 3.0 cable is very useful and the transfer is very fast.
customer_reviews.author: NaCl

customer_reviews.title: Great drive, but doubtful about "waterproof" claims
customer_reviews.text: I just got this a few days ago. I ordered it and it arrived quickly. The drive itself works great and the case it comes in definitely is sturdy. However, I'm disappointed because I purchased the A80 over the A60 because the A80 was advertised as being "waterproof" and the A60 only water resistant. Well, the flimsy rubber cover that covers the USB port on the drive won't even stay closed when it's sitting on my desk.. how could it possibly stay closed during an accidental water incident to be "waterproof"???
customer_reviews.author: LGray

customer_reviews.title: ... one for work) and it is hands down my favorite external drive
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these now (one for personal and one for work) and it is hands down my favorite external drive. Always reliable and fast, not to mention it s very portable!
customer_reviews.author: Krystle Correll

customer_reviews.title: Well-considered design, reliable, easy portability, great value
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of gear! Fast, robust, intelligent design. I've begun to switch my storage devices over to Silicon Power products, as I've never had a single problem with them. Reliable, secure backups & effortless install on every platform. Trustworthy portability. It just does what you want it to do well, no handholding.
customer_reviews.author: TAugust

customer_reviews.title: Good But Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: I've had the silicon since January of 2014. It is still working and while I haven't done a "crash" test, I did drop it a couple times. Currently there are a couple of chips on the side of the HD where the screws are located. Is it still considered waterproof(?) On occasion, it doesn't mount on the desktop of my 2011 MacBook Pro. I have to plug and unplug it for it to be recognized by the laptop. Also, the short USB cord that comes with it, doesn't work when plugged in. Lastly, the write speed is slower then other HDs I've used such the Western Digital Passport.
customer_reviews.author: SupaGiant

customer_reviews.title: Not rugged at all while transferring data
customer_reviews.text: Junk... It did not survive a 2 foot drop from the coffee table onto a carpeted floor while transferring data. My whole life was on this thing and it is all gone. I can't even begin to explain how devastated I am. 20 years of pictures, videos and files.... gone
customer_reviews.author: mfrisky

customer_reviews.title: Over 2 years of peace of mind and counting
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak to this products stress limits. I have never dropped it, never gotten water on it. But since March 2016 now it has given me peace of mind that all my data is safe. It has never glitched, never corrupted a file, and it just feels good to know that its rugged enough to protect my files if I ever DID drop it or take it on the road. So far so great.
customer_reviews.author: AMR

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, well built
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device in 2015. I am a heavy user. Still works, no problem. This constitutes (5x2=)10 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JAN GILLAN

customer_reviews.title: Great external drive - well made.
customer_reviews.text: Partitioned this and formatted and works perfectly for weekly backups of Windows 10. I really like that the shorter cable sits in its own nook with the drive so I just have to plug it in on my backup day. I will probably get more of these for external storage. Easy to use and nice and small.
customer_reviews.author: Paddy

customer_reviews.title: Great drive for Tesla Sentry
customer_reviews.text: Handles heat well, just the right size to fit in the dark depths of the Model 3 storage area, and handles a tremendous amount of Tesla Cam videos. Highly recommended, due to its rugged design and specs. No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: DLn

customer_reviews.title: I really love this drive
customer_reviews.text: 18 months in, still going strong. I really love this drive. It's decently fast for a portable hard drive. It never heats up. I recently did a 260gb transfer on it and at the end it was still cool. It's blue. Comes with two cables of different lengths. There are probably better options out there now, but it's still a great drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backup or portable hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Excellent backup or portable hard drive! Why would you put your sensitive data on a fragile external or portable when these are so reasonably priced? I bought one for my teacher daughter and one for her programmer fiance. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Lanter

customer_reviews.title: Still works amazing. I left it in the front seat of ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a full 2 years now. Still works amazing. I left it in the front seat of my car with the window down in a rain storm, by accident. It has also been dropped several times from about 3ft onto carpet. But, I must specify that my computer was not currently reading any files so I don't believe the disk was spinning at the time. If you drop just about any drive while the disk is spinning you will more than likely cause damage to the disk. So ignore the other reviews about it breaking when they dropped it.
customer_reviews.author: zechterling

customer_reviews.title: More space for games!
customer_reviews.text: I had to format the drive through my xbox one x for it to work, but once it formatted, the drive worked great! I would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to increase the amount of games on their xbox one or PlayStation 4.
customer_reviews.author: Judge

customer_reviews.title: The best I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Of the 4 portable hard disks I have bought this is the best, I surrender that security that it does not matter that I pass as it is practically a proeba of everything, I have tried it under water, I have dropped it and it continues working as if nothing happened. The only thing I complain about is that the usb 3.0 talk that comes on the side of the disc comes out very easily. But it is a highly recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Love this drive
customer_reviews.text: Love this drive! I am always on the go and my last drive was getting knocked around, dropped, and banged all the time. It now sounds like a salt shaker. So this is exactly what I needed. Love the value as well. Knowing that my docs, pictures, and videos are better protected helps me sleep better at night. If you are on the fence, get off and buy this. Silicon Power makes a great product. Highly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron1037

customer_reviews.title: Works as is, don't be a nerd and format it ext4 like me.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work fine out of the box, but being an elitist linux snob I had to format it and use ext4. I have problems when transfering large files from a linux guest running in vbox on a windows 10 host. Not sure where the problem is happening but I doubt it is the drive itself. I can't give it 5 stars because I have not drop tested it nor have a tested it's water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Hard drive!
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in this hard drive. When I first hooked it up it found an error right away thet cost my over 500 mb of the hard drive. I also have difficulty copying anything back off of it as it tells me the hard drive needs to be reformatted. If I do that, I'll lose all the info I foolishly used the hard drive to save. TKS-MTS
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Work great, strong
customer_reviews.text: Great USB external HDD. I have three or four of these in my inventory and have had no problems with them. On the newest one I ordered I was a little annoyed that the USB cable will not stay inside the side of the HDD. All the other ones work great and stay put. Overall, I will continue to order this model if I need more of them.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick I.

customer_reviews.title: Great USB 3.0 Portable Drive
customer_reviews.text: I have used this drive for a few days. While I cannot attest to the durability aspects, if it lives up to the specs, it will be my favorite portable drive. The dimensions are larger than most portables due to the extra width (1/2") and Height (3/4") used to house the connecting cable (dimensions are rough comparisons to a Toshiba 1TB Canvio). That being said, the connection is always with the drive, albeit short. The real benefits here are the added protection to vibration, dust, and moisture. While I would normally look at an SSD drive for those benefits, this one wins given the drive capacity and price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Sturdy Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid hard drive. It can fall without breaking at all. I have been using this hard drive for years and I have nothing to complain about (to be fair, my other drives (mostly WDs) also have lasted a long time without breaking). Besides being physically strong, the other big feature I like about this drive is the type of connection (I now pay very close attention to the type of connection a hard drive uses; I have had hard drives becoming useless because the connection got broken and there was no way to reconnect it). Since nothing is ever perfect, the only thing I don`t really about the package is that the cord is (very) short.
customer_reviews.author: Mone Yevol

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product (along with a protective case) to back up all of the media collection on my computer. I have used it 5 times and it is now completely dead. The device looks like brand new and has no damage to it any way. It just stopped working after 5 uses.
customer_reviews.author: bkolas

customer_reviews.title: Solid and durable hard drive, two years running
customer_reviews.text: I brought this thing with me to a tropical island, replete with heat, humidity, and corrosive salt, and it still works to this day, two years later. Very pleased with my purchase, and no sign yet that it's wearing out. I thought the little blue USB 3.0 cord would've started coming loose from its holster by now, but it still fits in just fine. I don't use it every day, so it may not see as much wear and tear as some users, but it's still a very solid product (made in Taiwan!)
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Davis

customer_reviews.title: Drive appears sturdy & I hope it lasts as good as it ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to backup my pictures & documents on a desk top that was in need of repair. This did the job and I was able to save everything to another computer witout any problems. Drive appears sturdy & I hope it lasts as good as it looks. The only thing I did not like about this drive was the USB cord stored in the side of the unit. The cord does not seem to fit or want to stay very well but other than that minor design flaw I absolutely love this external hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband. He hands a huge audible book library and wanted to back them all up. This fit the bill! He’s very pleased with its sturdy design and fast speed.
customer_reviews.author: E&E0715Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Had it for less than 6 months and the connection for the USB to the drive became loose and disconnects with the slightest movement. Not great for a drive to use on the go.
customer_reviews.author: chad d

customer_reviews.title: Great backup for more than a year
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Using/used this for More than a year. Using as backup now and am expecting to use it as a temp storage for designs. I’m expecting to have no problem as it’s done really well for simple backups
customer_reviews.author: NanSpra

customer_reviews.title: I love the size and the lack of bulky cords because ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got this but have found nothing to complain about. I love the size and the lack of bulky cords because it is convenient to take anywhere and will fit easily in my purse as it's smaller than my tablet but larger than my cell phone. I was thankful to watch another reviewer's post with a demonstration by him that proved the waterproof/drop proof claims so that I need not attempt the same demonstration. Even taking as many pictures and preserving my family's old pictures as I do, it will take me a while to fill the 1 TB capacity.
customer_reviews.author: ThriceaGranny

customer_reviews.title: Total failure
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't even transfer once my photos. Broke and can not format at all, doesn't respond, my computers can not recognize the device . Total waste of money. Skip this product for your own good
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Silicon Power Rugged Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rugged hard drive to pair with my Macbook Air. The hard drive is an absolute dog. The HD stopped working after 6 months of limited use. My Macbook Air won't recognize the drive. I tried to get an RMA from the company; and the company's website became unusable during my attempts to register my RMA. Don't buy this device. I have a Toshiba HD that has worked for years without a problem. I would like Amazon to take this device back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Small 1 TD Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: The Silicon Power Rugged Armor A80 1 TB 2.5-Inch USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 Military Grade Portable External Hard Drive came well packed ... having a bit of concern about G loads during shipping, I used it to back-up my existing 1TB HDD Back-Up Drive ... so now I have redundant back-up ... other than the amount of time it took (not the fault of the drive, but rather the amount of data transferred)it was flawless ... there were no problems powering the drive from a single USB source (I considered I may need to use a siamese USB cable to boost the power) ... I would recommend this drive to a friend with no fear of disappointing them ...
customer_reviews.author: Ken Ostrye

customer_reviews.title: Only one problem...
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough as a drive. Quiet, no drive failures or corrupted data. But it claims to be a USB 3.0 drive. However, when I plug it into a USB 3 port, all I get is USB 2.0 transfer speeds.
customer_reviews.author: D. T. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: TWO of these have failed on me. Unreliable, Skip this.
customer_reviews.text: I've had TWO of these fail on me. The first one was replaced by the company and the second failed not long after I got it. They look as if they're working once their plugged in with the blue light turning on, but then no computer shows that they're plugged in. AVOID this one if you need something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Walker-McCune

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks! Not a whole lot to say about an external hard drive that functions perfectly, but there you go! Its supposedly really rugged, wheras you could drop it and it would be okay, which provides me a lot of peace of mind when I'm using it in the go. Not that I'm actively trying to test this thing. Holds a lot, and is a good price for that, but ontop of that it is compact and rugged! Hard to find a better 1tb external hd!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: It was nice to see that not only did they send the ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast write speeds, around 75mb/s transferring from another external HDD. The drive is a little bit bigger than another 2.5" external that I have, about 1/2" taller and wider and maybe 1/4" thicker, but it is no more than what you would expect from any other rugged electronic device. It was nice to see that not only did they send the short USB cable that fits into the side of the drive but also a longer one. Not a huge deal but it is always nice to see a company do little things to give the customer a better experience.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Harbison

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST PORTABLE HARD DRIVE
customer_reviews.text: This drive is very well made. It is slim and compact, and has a nice storage slot for the short USB cable. The drive is very fast in 2.0 and wickedly fast in3.0. The perfict drive for keeping all your stuff on when using multiple computers. It goes from Linux to Windows 8.1, 8.2, Windows 7, XP Pro, and Mac 10 with no problem!!!! Very cool. Truly plug and play and no drivers to download!!! Plug it in and within 5 seconds you are ready to go!!!! The price is Fantastic, $65.00 here on Amazon!!!!! AWESOME DEAL!!!!! GREAT PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MWB

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, but still quite delicate.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in July, and here I am in October- it's a paperweight. It fell 2 feet onto carpet while it was plugged in. A complete accident, and now it is useless, and nonreturnable. Frustrating. I will likely not invest in "rugged" moving parts external drives ever again. Before it broke, it worked wonderfully and rather quickly: plug and play, instantly connected, lots of space... If you're interested in this drive, keep in mind that it is just as delicate when it's plugged in as any other moving parts drive. From now on I may stick to other, electronics specific stores for my hard drive purchases, however.
customer_reviews.author: Layla Rowen

customer_reviews.title: Dead after two years from purchase- can't retrieve data
customer_reviews.text: Totally useless and lost all my back up data- never dropped- bought a special zip up carrier- etc etc- but it looks like it has an expiration date on working and just stops after 2 1/2 years so BEWARE ` - a waste of my money- it may have a "protective" case but that didn't mean anything since it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Sewandread

customer_reviews.title: Everything is gone in 2 years
customer_reviews.text: It started working fine, then two years worth of work are gone. Light turns on, data is gone, a clicking sound is new. Won't buy this brand ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Nice, tough unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice, tough unit. I've already dropped in (while plugged in and running) from about two feet and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: surprising look not what i expected to look & feel like but great if it actually protects
customer_reviews.text: Reformatted to nfts & 101gb to fat32 for my Xbox (it saves data for it). I really like this, can play the games/music flawlessly on 360. The movies on the nfts half are good on computer Actually it's a little fatter than old HDD but it's lighter than it looks & kinda looks like a square toy cause of it's blue like casing
customer_reviews.author: tanecl (xbox tag)

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months and 1 biz trip.  Useless.
customer_reviews.text: "Rugged" product failed after 1 business trip. Useless. I bought for ruggedness but it had no exterior damage but won't connect to computer anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these and they work great. Never a problem so far and it is plug and play for windows 10
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore Artusa

customer_reviews.title: So far I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly small unit--smaller than the size of a paperback. I hope to NEVER have a chance to test the shockproof, waterproof, etc. capabilities, but I'll update if I do. I think it's terrific to have a tiny cord tucked into the back and to also have a longer one included; I've had so many electronic gadgets come missing pieces parts over the last couple of years that it's a wonderful surprise to have something come that's ready to go, right out of the box. MOST highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, so easy to take with me everywhere my laptop goes.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this hard drive. I wanted something to fit right in my laptop bag--not bulky or cumbersome, and this does it! Love that the cable clips right in the side, so I never find myself in situations where I have forgotten it. And the fact that it can withstand abuse is a plus with me, since my dog has killed several drives in moments of energy through the house. Only within the past month (I've had it for 10 months) has the USB cable begun to wiggle in the USB slot of my laptop--so it unintentionally "ejects" now... happens to all USB connections sooner or later, I suppose....
customer_reviews.author: nk29

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully this is as good as it should be
customer_reviews.text: I have two SP external hard drives so I have a backup. I bought the shock proof one as a coworker dropped hers and lost everything on it...don't want that to happen to me. Hopefully this is as good as it should be...the company has good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Kibbles

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Excellent Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and this is perfect for the road. It's small enough that it fits in the side pouch of the Case Logic neoprene laptop sleeve. Well thought out design to store the USB cable, excellent build quality overall. And it's fast - it reads / writes a 1GB file in about 12 seconds on my Macbook Air (2013 SSD). This is my first Silicon Power product and I'll definitely buy more. I haven't dropped it or water tested it, but it's good to know, and for a similar price to normal drives!
customer_reviews.author: Vancity

customer_reviews.title: Best rugged HD!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this drive for two years, so I speak from some experience. We live on a sailboat, so we have invested in better computer equipment, including Panasonic Toughbooks, and Silicon Power hard drives. While the HD has not yet suffered any serious abuse, other than constant 88 degree 85% RH salt air, it has performed flawlessly. We just added a new 2TB drive for photos because we were so happy with the original 1TB drive. I can recommend this drive without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Smith

customer_reviews.title: ... me in any emergency (keep in emergency kit) I like the short cord which will work well with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Was able to download all my docs/pictures from my PC and I will hopefully be able to use this to take with me in any emergency (keep in emergency kit) I like the short cord which will work well with my laptop on a desk (you can see in the picture that it just snaps into the side. The other USB cord is perfect length and works well too. Packaged well, no damage, I think it will live up to it's claims.
customer_reviews.author: GreenApple

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: Great for carrying around in your bookbag or purse but also in humid climates or dusty zones. Performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Ciprian

customer_reviews.title: Please correct size dimension's to 4.5" x 1.6" x 6.5" .
customer_reviews.text: I really like the HDD, but the Dimension's posted on site are wrong. There fore the case shown with HDD, could never fit! It should read {size 4.5" x 1.6" x 6.5"}
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD's

customer_reviews.title: Larger and heavier than most portable drives
customer_reviews.text: Very rugged but heavy and larger than usual 4" size of portable terabyte drives. Won't fit the carrier I bought with it, so it will live with my PC as is. Nicely rounded. 5 1/2" x 3 3/4" so will just sew up a 'bag' to put it in for ease of stashing in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Advocate for Truth

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy portable Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not tested the ruggedness of this drive by dropping or otherwise mistreating it, there is some comfort in knowing that it has been ruggedized. Even though it uses a USB 3 interface, don't expect a big speed increase. A hard drive can only pull data off the disk so fast, and its this limit that will determine the data transfer rate. I am seeing about 85 MB/sec for sustained transfers. An SSD may make use of the higher data rate, or a RAID 0 set-up. I'm happy with the disk for what it is and travel with it as extra storage for my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff Collector

customer_reviews.title: Don't lose the cable, and don't use without a powered USB hub
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the cable for this drive is unlike anything I've ever seen, since it has A connectors on both ends. Don't lose it, or you will be sad. The drive tends to not work if you don't use it with a powered hub. It will show up as removable storage, but with no storage media. This suggests a pretty intelligent USB controller onboard the drive, which makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gatliff

customer_reviews.title: Great little portable drive
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for the better part of a year and I love it. I bought the Drive Logic DL-64 carrying case for it and it fits perfect. USB 2.0 is a little laggy, but I can copy 1-3 Gb movie files to this in less than 2 minutes over USB 3.0. Even hooks right into my tv's USB port for easy movie watching. No special software or anything needed. So if you watch lots of 'backup copies' of your movies this is a great storage option. I didn't ever drop mine, but never felt worried tossing it onto a desk or something elevated.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: HUGE + must re-format for MacBook
customer_reviews.text: This thing is much bigger than pictures make it look! You also have to reformat the device for MacBook before it is recognized by your computer, that didn't take time to figure out haha. And the company doesn't have any support in English really haha. just save your time and get the SSD drive.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Torres

customer_reviews.title: Works out of the Box with Yosemite
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the WD My Passport for Mac because my 2014 iMac with Yosemite would not read it. Now the good news: I bought the Silicon and it works with My iMac running Yosemite. I plugged the Silicon into my USB and in seconds it showed up on my screen. I then transferred many music files, photos, and documents to my new external hard drive and they all got saved in less than a minute. The Silicon is a winner for iMac users running Yosemite.
customer_reviews.author: M. JEFFREY MCMAHON

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine up to six months, but then abruptly died. Never dropped, never taken off of my desk. Rugged? I think not. Hopefully our military doesn't actually use defective products like this to defend our country.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel the trumpeter

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Update: two and a half years of almost daily use in, and this little drive hasn't showed a single sign of failing. A small piece of plastic has chipped and the rubber USB port cover has gotten loose, but overall I'm incredibly happy with how it's held up! This hard drive is fantastic. The ruggedness is great for peace of mind but oddly enough the feature that I've found myself most grateful for is the little 3-inch USB3 cord that lives in the side of the drive. Not having to carry around another cable is incredibly useful.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Amazing amount of storage for they price and it runs ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fast hard drive!! Amazing amount of storage for they price and it runs very fast so you don't have to worry about it showing down your work process!! And it's very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Johannes

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Works well
customer_reviews.text: Worked well backing up my SD cards to during my recent trip to Yellowstone. No issues at all. I did purchase a cheap cast off of ebay to transport it in
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but limited
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't feel as durable as I hoped but the cord tucked in the side makes it super convenient. Also, it won't load files over 4GB ...not the best for storing movies
customer_reviews.author: T M

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for a project and shelved them until ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a project and shelved them until needed. Now I needed them and one does not recognize and the other has multiple surface errors in brand new condition. These are junk.
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It goes with me everywhere and acts as a backup to all my photos and music in case my laptop dies. I have 7 thousand songs on it and over 10 thousand photos and it's only 20% full. Again, love this. Couldn't be happier. And it functions well even though it lives in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Faster than internal drive
customer_reviews.text: Using CrystalDiskMark, this drive tests at 117.4MB/s read, 116.7MB/s write. My internal, 7200rpm SATA drive was 112 and 113 respectively (ThinkPad x220 i7). On the random read/write tests, the differences were more pronounced. Very impressive! There were several low reviews mentioning the high pitched whine. If I put my ear directly against the drive, I can hear a whine, similar in pitch to a CRT (which I can still hear too, even if it's rare that I encounter one), but from further than a foot away, it's not noticeable in a quiet room.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Abernathy Bump

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, low cost mass storage device.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect external drive. Perfect size and form factor. With 1TB of storage, plenty of room. Comes with a nice short USB cable that stores in the drive and a longer unit for greater flexibility. Awesome price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Really nice color and sturdy material.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice color and sturdy material. Fast delivery, I loved it!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: NLTS Publishing

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Works super fast and i dont have to worry about losing precious files dropping or getting it wet! I feel much more relaxed knowing i have gear that will have my back in any situation. I wish everything was shock and waterproof! Looks and feels sleek and takes hardly any space. It also comes with a longer usb cord that works great (the smaller one is good for travel or emergency)
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: It works good. Transfer rate seems to be fast
customer_reviews.text: It works good. Transfer rate seems to be fast, compared to what I am used to, all perspective I guess. I have not done the drop test to verify how rugged it really is, and haven't dropped it yet, by accident, so I can't help anyone with that. It comes with a super short cord, and a long one, bout 2 1/2 feet, I could use a longer one, but I have heard its special, because of the ends, so I don't know if that is possible. I bought it also, because the price is good for a rugged 1T, by silicon power. I am happy with it, so far, after 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: mcastro

customer_reviews.title: Great portable hd.
customer_reviews.text: Great hard drive. No issues at all. Been bounced around while traveling and on the boat. Store movies and other media for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: OneXBigTom

customer_reviews.title: The only thing i don't like about this is the fact that the 'waterproof' guarantee ...
customer_reviews.text: The only thing i don't like about this is the fact that the 'waterproof' guarantee is hanging on by a little rubber flap that you put over the USB port, it works but i would rather at least have a latch or something. I took it apart and everything inside looks exactly like what the said on the description and pictures so no problems there.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney L.

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Buyer
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second one of these for my MacBook so I can rotate them for the Time Machine backup and keep a copy at another location. These play very nice with my MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: Heath M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Good external drive
customer_reviews.text: Bought for more Xbox storage. My son is happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: crash

customer_reviews.title: I like the quality so far
customer_reviews.text: Totally impressed with one of the reviews that I watched I had to buy this for myself... I like the quality so far... haven't put a ton on it yet but working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great and Reliable product
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a very durable drive this would be the drive to buy. I can confirm that it is a legitimate product and a very reliable one too. I have not had any problems with it since I bought it in 2013 and still continue to use it on a daily basis. The usb 3.0 compatibility is a plus! if your looking for something reasonability price and worth the money this is the product to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon

customer_reviews.title: Great external hard drive and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extra drive for all my photography and photos. This drive is great!! Moved about 167G over very quickly and set up folders for future use. Just plug and play. It is small and travels very easily which was very important as well. I did have to buy a case separately - but this was still a great price! I think I am going to buy another one for all of our movies!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use "plug & play" (I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use "plug & play" (I'm using Mac - no special installation, drivers or reformatting needed). The only thing I find useless is that super-short usb cable, however, it's probably just me. Overall, good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: iZay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and built tough!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hard drive. This thing can take a beating and because of that it is an excellent choice to carry with you whenever you have laptop with you or just as a portable storage device to use in any computer platform. Just plug and play, no drivers needed. At 1 TB I managed to partition the drive and reserved one of my partitions for my OS backup while still having plenty of room for all my personal data.
customer_reviews.author: Novice Handy-Person

customer_reviews.title: Durable, well designed hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Durable, well designed hard drive, just plug in and its ready to use. If you have a smart tv with a media interface you can plug this right into your tv and watch movies or listen to music or view pictures. Comes with 2 usb cables, one short one that tucks into the side of the hard drive so it's always with you, very handy. Highly recommended, trouble free drive. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Pollyessster

customer_reviews.title: Great for College Classes
customer_reviews.text: I love how small and portable this hard drive is. It's compact enough to carry with me in my purse or book bag and it has more than enough storage space for my needs. I love using it as opposed to a thumb drive because I tend to leave thumb drives in the school computers. This one is large enough that I won't forget it while still small enough to be portable. And it's sturdier than a thumb drive.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Heid

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to be around children so I wouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be around children so I wouldn't brake a thumb drive. It holds a ton of documents, videos, pictures, flipcharts, and other items that use a bunch of memory. I have dropped it several times and it's still going strong. I do use the longer cord more than the short one, I actually have lost the short one, the holding part was a little lose.
customer_reviews.author: ID

customer_reviews.title: It looks good. that's all I can say positive about it
customer_reviews.text: Every time I hook it up to either of my lap tops to back up data. It locks them up. I've down loaded the required widget's online instructions. My ASUS lap top is I-7 chip set more than enough memory and hard drive space. 3.0 USB port. Tired of trying to get to work has a three year warranty on it. But more trouble than it's worth to return and wait for God only knows, how long and how many Hoops would have to jump through to get it replaced or working. Will just use Cd's to back up. It looks good. that's all I can say positive about it. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Woodcanoe2u

customer_reviews.title: Airport Extreme disk access problem solved
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this external drive to connect to my Apple Airport Extreme Router allowing WiFi access to that hard drive from all my networked computers. The first several times I connected the drive I received error messages (Enable Net Bios). I changed the name of this hard drive to a generic one word name and that solved the problem. No mods to the network! All is well
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: Feels like I'll be with this little guy for decades to come
customer_reviews.text: It is what is says it is, rugged and durable to the the point where it feels like I'll be with this little guy for decades to come. I trust it with my information and have it as my one and only backup drive. Update: Have had no problems with it after 11 months.
customer_reviews.author: G.R

customer_reviews.title: A life saver!
customer_reviews.text: At a critical time I discovered that my computer backup disk had stopped working. My computer is old and I found that local stores didn't carry any backup drives that would work with my operating system. I found this on Amazon and it worked like a champ. It was easy to install and has been working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley A. Slick

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Got tired of backing up files on different usb sticks, because kept running out of space.
customer_reviews.author: VICTOR CARUSI

product_meta.title: Silicon Power 1TB Rugged Portable External Hard Drive Armor A80, Waterproof USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, Xbox and PS4, Blue
product_meta.description:
Capacity:1 TB| Color:Blue

Military-grade Shockproof, IPX7 Waterproof and Pressure-resistant Protections
Armor A80 incorporates heavy-duty aluminum casing, interior rubber sealing and internal suspension system which altogether assure rigid protections against any unexpected situations such as rain, liquid-spillage or accidental drops.

Cable-carry design
The innovative slot design is especially equipped for simple cable carrying and storing by which you can easily stick the cable to the drive.

Sturdy and Stylish Metallic Casing
Armor A80 is equipped with the aluminum exterior which can not only provide strong protection against outer pressure but also show the trendy look that complements your fashion style on-the-go.

Ultra-fast Transfer Speed
SuperSpeed USB 3.0 interface enables blazing-fast speed performance to quickly transfer large files including HD videos, high-resolution photos and great numbers of documents in seconds.

3-year Warranty
The Armor A80 is backed by a 3-year warranty that guarantees complete services and technical support.

Box Contains
1 x Silicon Power Armor A80 External Hard Drive
2 x USB 3.0 Cable (107 mm & 550 mm)
feature_bullets: Work with Ideal for gaming enthusiasts Xbox One, Xbox 360, PS4, PS4 Pro and PS4 Slim (PS4 System Software version 4.50 or higher).
Military-grade shockproof and IPX7 waterproof protection. Sturdy aluminum casing enables high pressure-resistant function to withstand up to 300 kg of force.
Cable storage design for simple cable carrying.
USB 3.1 Gen 1 interface, backward compatible with USB 3.0/USB 2.0
3 year manufacturer warranty. (Please register your product via SP official website to get the complete manufacturer warranty services, product support and more.)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,386 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
